Probably from {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=しくんし}} compound {{m|ltc|四君子|tr=*sì *giuən *tziə̌|lit=four gentlemen}}. Compare modern {{cog|zh|四君子|tr=Sì Jūnzi}}.

{{ja-pron|yomi=on|acc=2|acc_ref=DJR|しくんし}}

===Proper noun===
{{ja-pos|proper|しくんし}}

# the Four Gentlemen: '''''[[梅|ume]]''''' (the [[plum]] [[blossom]], symbolising [[winter]]), '''''[[蘭|ran]]''''' (the [[orchid]], symbolizing [[spring]]), '''''[[竹|matsu]]''''', (the [[bamboo]], symbolizing [[summer]]), and '''''[[菊|kiku]]''''' ([[chrysanthemum]], symbolizing [[autumn]]):
#: These four plants are often the [[subject]] of [[traditional]] [[Chinese]], [[Korean]], and [[Japanese]] [[painting]]s, with each often used to represent one of the four [[season]]s; [[winter]], [[spring]], [[summer]], and [[autumn]], respectively.
